answer_content: It's difficult to make friends at any age, but here's some tips I have learned to be more approachable: 1) Wear bright colors or earthy colors (I notice people approach me more when I wear brighter colored clothing or earth tones, such as brown and orange) 2) Smile at people and give direct eye contact (it gets more natural with practice) 3) Act confident, act like you are the most awesome person in the world (even if its not true, lol). People can sense insecurity more than you think, so even if you have naturally low self esteem, just fake it til you make it 4) Dont try so hard and just be more open and approachable with your body language (don't cross your legs/arms and be more open) 5) Approach people first, I think we all think others should approach us first but what ends up happening is no one ever makes the first move, so if you take the initiative to make things happen they will.

question_title: My kitten can't handle solid food?
question_content: I got the runt of the litter, so problems are to be expected, but I'm a bit confused. When I first got her she had ear mites, had a stuffy nose, and wasn't eating because she couldn't smell. We took her to the vet and they gave me some meds for her. Two 1/4 parts of 1 pill, some vitamins to give her her appetite back, and some antibiotics (nothing for the ear mites. I had been treating it with over the counter stuff). She got on all of that and was eating again within a day. Before she got sick she was eating solid food with no problems, but after she got sick all of a sudden she can't handle it. I took her off of the antibiotic after about 2 weeks because it was making her throw up everything she ate, and now that she's off she can keep down kitten formula, but can no longer take solid food without throwing it right back up. answer_content: I celebrate a secular mid winter festival that has it's origins in Pre-Christian Pagan European culture

Well let's see, the word Christmas comes from Crisse Maesse or Christ's Mass. While many cultures in places like Rome and Europe already had a winter festival, the Christian church only celebrated Easter. That changed in the fourth century. The birthday of Christ, though not recorded in the bible, was first celebrated as January 6th. This changed in 1743 when Pope Julius The First made the date December 25th to coincide with the Pagan Saturnalia Festival. For a time in Boston, 1659 to 1681, Christmas was outlawed, but by 1870 it was declared a national holiday and remains one to this day.

question_title: Creationists, there ARE things about Science you trust, right?
question_content: For example, if you are out watching Nascar, or whatever other cultural pastime you like to indulge in, you buy sunglasses that block UV light. You KNOW UV is bad for your eyes, and you trust that the glasses will do what the label claims. Yet you don't think about or investigate how the UV is blocked by the lenses (or rather the coating) before it hits your eyes. You trust that the Scientists who discovered, patented and perfected this coating knew what they were doing. Likewise when you take an analgesic like Asprin or Tylenol. You trust that the Scientists that discovered these drugs knew what they were doing. You trust that the Science behind these drugs is sound and that it is being perfected and researched on an ongoing basis. Yet you don't look into how these drugs are made or how they work. So why, when it comes to the Science of Evolution, do you balk and deny? The Science is there, it has over 150 years of peer reviewed Science backing it and to this day, not ONE single theory has ever given us a different explanation as to the changes biology undergoes over time. So, why do you pick and choose what Science you're going to believe and which one you're not?

I commend you for having a boyfriend that goes to church.  When he said "you are a blessing", that means you are a good thing in his life, someone who inspires and motivates him.  You didn't say which church, so I'll try and give you some straight forward generic info.  Most Christian churches believe in the Bible. The Bible is a combination of 39 books in the Old Testament and 27 books in the New Testament. The NT is about Jesus Christ's life here on earth. Jesus had 12 apostles who received the Melchizedek priesthood from him. None of the apostles passed their priesthood on to anyone else and therefore was lost. Almost 200 years ago, it was restored. Watch these videos for more about the life of Jesus. http://www.lds.org/scriptures/nt/matt/18…

By calling you a blessing, I'm sure he means that he thinks you are a special gift from God. The Christian church is based on the following of Christ Jesus and his teachings as written in the Bible.  Basically, the church was established by Jesus' disciples, especially Paul who helped start many of the original Christian churches.  Our Bible was written by various people in history, from Moses and the prophets of the Old Testament to Jesus' disciples in the New Testament.  Our main belief is that we are all sinners and have been disconnected from God due to our own sin.  God chose the Jewish people to be a nation of priests for him and gave them rules to live by.  However, these rules, like the 10 commandments, for example, do not allow us to actually get rid of our sin.  We can't get close to God directly because God is perfect and we, obviously, are not.  However, God loves us so much that he sent his son Jesus into the world as a human to be sacrificed as a sin offering for all of our sins.  To become a Christian you have to recognize the fact that you are a sinner and want be forgiven.  Acknowledge that you believe that Jesus is the Son of God and died for you and ask him to come into your life.  Your name will be written in God's book of life for the end of the world.  The Bible tells us that All have sinned and fall short of the Glory of God, and are justified freely by his Grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.  It goes on to teach us that the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. We cannot reach God and have eternal life through any works of our own.  In Ephesians, Paul teaches us that is 'by Grace you have been saved, through faith -- and this not from yourselves, it is the gift of God -- not by works, so that no one can boast.  We do good works because we love God, it is the result of our faith, not to try and enter Heaven.  You can't get to Heaven by being 'better' than anyone else.  We are all in the same boat.  Jesus died on a cross to save us from our sins and was buried and rose again as our savior.  We don't worship a crucified lord, but a risen savior.  We have faith that he will return for all who have called upon His name when the time comes and we will go to Heaven.   Do you know what faith is?  Faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.  When God returns to Earth and everyone is judged, if your name is not written the Book of Life, you will be judged for all of your sins.  However, the Good News is that if you believe in Jesus and have confessed this and asked Him to come into your life, God will accept you into his Heaven, because he will see Jesus in you instead of you alone.  Jesus covers your sins.  God offers this gift for anyone who believes, no matter what race.  This does not mean that after we are saved that we will not sin.  However, we will be forgiven of our sins when we ask for forgiveness.  We are a part of the family and brothers and sisters in Christ.  Does your father disown you because you do something wrong?  Of course not.  He is disappointed in you and you will feel bad until you tell him about what happened and ask him to forgive you.  Same thing with God, but you must come to him freely of your own choice through Jesus or He can't recognize you as one of his own. As to the Church itself, churches were established in many countries and slowly spread west. The Catholic church had a major impact in spreading the news and many other denominations eventually sprang up with different customs and/or beliefs, but underlying them all is the Good News of Jesus. Like I've said before, we all are sinners and always will be.  Churches have many people in them that are not Christian.  Some will fall away, but hopefully we are all seeking the same thing and they will eventually see the light, but others are still blind and only go for other reasons like just being part of a social group.  We have to reach out to these people and not reject them for we are no better than they are. May God bless you in your journey.  Ask your boyfriend your questions.  Don't be shy. Tell him you don't understand, but want to learn.   He will be more than happy to help!

Okay, first off, "higher up in space" doesn't make any sense.  The reason astronauts appear to have aged less than those on earth is due to relativity.  The faster you move the slower time travels in your frame of reference.  Spacecraft move much faster than the rotation of the earth and so they're slightly younger when they return.  It isn't drastic, though.  Even if you spent a year in geosynchronous orbit you'd have only been minutes younger.  This happens all the time, by the way.  When you walk around time from your reference frame is ever so slightly slower because you're moving. Even if you took a spaceship near the speed of light and stayed like that you wouldn't be living longer from your reference frame.

answer_content: The vagina is naturally moist, and some of the moisture seeps much of the time. The discharge can be clear or white when you're healthy, yellow or faintly green if you have an infection. When you ovulate, the quantity increases and the consistency changes, becoming something like an egg white. (Use mini-pads, if this bothers you.) That sounds a lot like what you had. I don't know about you, of course, but lots of women are more eager for sex when they're ovulating, so it could be the discharge you had and your ovulation coincided, and then your sexual activity and its additional natural lubrication made the usual ovulation discharge more obvious. Clear discharge is no cause for concern at all.

It will just make it thicker and more pronounced, as it would with the hair on your head. As for prenatal pills, there is no reason you shouldn't take them just because you aren't pregnant. Here is part of an article. As you will see, there are other ways of getting a UTI. Regardless you really need to see a doctor otherwise it could get worse. Most urinary tract infections are bladder infections. A bladder infection usually is not serious if it is treated right away. If you do not take care of a bladder infection, it can spread to your kidneys. A kidney infection is serious and can cause permanent damage. What causes urinary tract infections? Usually, germs get into your system through your urethra, the tube that carries urine from your bladder to the outside of your body. The germs that usually cause these infections live in your large intestine and are found in your stool. If these germs get inside your urethra, they can travel up into your bladder and kidneys and cause an infection. Women tend to get more bladder infections than men. This is probably because women have shorter urethras, so it is easier for the germs to move up to their bladders. Having sex can make it easier for germs to get into your urethra. You may be more likely to get an infection if you do not drink enough fluids, you have diabetes, or you are pregnant. The chance that you will get a bladder infection is higher if you have any problem that blocks the flow of urine from your bladder. Examples include having kidney stones or an enlarged prostate gland. For reasons that are not well understood, some women get bladder infections again and again. What are the symptoms? You may have an infection if you have any of these symptoms: You feel pain or burning when you urinate. You feel like you have to urinate often, but not much urine comes out when you do. Your belly feels tender or heavy. Your urine is cloudy or smells bad. You have pain on one side of your back under your ribs. This is where your kidneys are. You have fever and chills. You have nausea and vomiting. Call your doctor right away if you think you have an infection and: You have a fever, nausea and vomiting, or pain in one side of your back under your ribs. You have diabetes, kidney problems, or a weak immune system

Concerning cosmological evolution, the Church has infallibly defined that the universe was specially created out of nothing. Vatican I solemnly defined that everyone must "confess the world and all things which are contained in it, both spiritual and material, as regards their whole substance, have been produced by God from nothing" (Canons on God the Creator of All Things, canon 5). The Church does not have an official position on whether the stars, nebulae, and planets we see today were created at that time or whether they developed over time (for example, in the aftermath of the Big Bang that modern cosmologists discuss). However, the Church would maintain that, if the stars and planets did develop over time, this still ultimately must be attributed to God and his plan, for Scripture records: "By the word of the Lord the heavens were made, and all their host [stars, nebulae, planets] by the breath of his mouth" (Ps. 33:6). Concerning biological evolution, the Church does not have an official position on whether various life forms developed over the course of time. However, it says that, if they did develop, then they did so under the impetus and guidance of God, and their ultimate creation must be ascribed to him.

Indeed, it's unlikely that our biological "family tree" will ever be known with certainty. The two most famous figures in hominid paleontology, Richard Leakey and Donald Johansen (discoverer of "Lucy") are in complete disagreement over man's ancestry. Richard Lewontin, professor of zoology at Harvard, said in an interview: "We don't know anything about the ancestors of the human species . . . . Despite the excited and optimistic claims that have been made by some paleontologists, no fossil hominid species can be established as our direct ancestor."

That's correct. The Biblical sense of the word "soul" is "a living person". This belief is not limited to JWs; many other Christians reject the doctrine of a distinct spiritual substance that migrates independently from the world to some afterlife.

We believe what the Bible teaches about the subject. We ARE souls and don't have one. “Soul” and “Spirit”—What Do These Terms Really Mean? WHEN you hear the terms “soul” and “spirit,” what comes to your mind? Many believe that these words mean something invisible and immortal that exists inside us. They think that at death this invisible part of a human leaves the body and lives on. Since this belief is so widespread, many are surprised to learn that it is not at all what the Bible teaches. What, then, is the soul, and what is the spirit, according to God’s Word? “SOUL” AS USED IN THE BIBLE First, consider the soul. You may remember that the Bible was originally written mainly in Hebrew and Greek. When writing about the soul, the Bible writers used the Hebrew word ne′phesh or the Greek word psy·khe′. These two words occur well over 800 times in the Scriptures, and the New World Translation consistently renders them “soul.” When you examine the way “soul” or “souls” is used in the Bible, it becomes evident that this word basically refers to (1) people, (2) animals, or (3) the life that a person or an animal enjoys. p. 209Let us consider some scriptures that present these three different senses. People. “In Noah’s days . . . a few people, that is, eight souls, were carried safely through the water.” (1 Peter 3:20) Here the word “souls” clearly stands for people—Noah, his wife, his three sons, and their wives. Exodus 16:16 mentions instructions given to the Israelites regarding the gathering of manna. They were told: “Pick up some of it . . . according to the number of the souls that each of you has in his tent.” So the amount of manna that was gathered was based upon the number of people in each family. Some other Biblical examples of the application of “soul” or “souls” to a person or to people are found at Genesis 46:18; Joshua 11:11; Acts 27:37; and Romans 13:1.

There is balance in all things.  Dark, light.  White, black.  Positive, negative.  and so on.  Without balance, things cannot exist. Even when we walk, we use muscles to keep our balance, some pulling one way, and then others the other way, to keep us from falling. So, for the possibility of humans to exist ( or any living thing) there has to be balance. If a human's muscles stop working in one direction in the legs, that person would fall down. That is how it works, God did not make the person fall down, the muscles did. But if God was to remove the muscles to keep the person from falling down, then the person would be totally unable to walk at all.  And if God was to make the muscles to never get tired or stop working, the person would live forever, he would never wear out.   And a few thousand years of life, can become rather boring and tiring in itself. The point is, God did not put " bad " into the world, it simply exists, because "good" exists.  It is the balance.  But it is up to us, to choose if we allow "good" to influence us, or "bad" to influence us. INFLUENCE.  That is the word.  We are not forced to do anything, we are influenced to do things.
